title: New: Windbreaker – I Hate My Soul
body:
Having been raised on The Clash, The Adicts and Stiff Little Finger, Boston’s **Windbreaker** aka Darin Thompson, fits in perfectly with my 70’s punk tastes.

A jagged guitar riff that isn’t too far from the likes of White Riot or Rock The Casbah, I Hate My Soul is the third track from Thompson, and continues the development of his emotionally unstable pop-punk that’s sure to seep under your skin. **Windbreaker** releases his debut EP **_Let It Go_** on 11 November through [Heart Throb Records](http://heartthrobrecords.bandcamp.com/album/let-it-go-ep)

now I know why  
that song you tried  
to sing to death  
was relevant  
it perched my soul  
the pitch seeped in  
now I should sleep  
and make amends
